Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libblkid
exit 0

#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk libblkid
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: util-linux bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The util-linux packages contain a large variety of low-level system utilities that are necessary for a Linux system to function. Among others, these include the fdisk configuration tool and the login program. This update fixes the following bugs: The uuidd daemon was previously configured with a "timeout" option that caused uuidd to stop after 60 seconds of inactivity. When another UUID was requested from the daemon, it had to be started again first and then it would generate a new UUID, which could potentially cause problems if the request required very fast handling. With this update, the "timeout" option has been removed and the uuidd daemon runs permanently, which improves performance and makes UUID generation more robust. (BZ#1092039) The libblkid library previously incorrectly probed private Logical Volume Manager (LVM) devices for file systems, which caused LVM thin-provisioning pool devices to be mistakenly interpreted as mountable block devices. Attempting to mount an LVM thin-provisioning pool device consequently caused XFS metadata corruption. This update fixes the underlying code and thus prevents the described problem from occurring. (BZ#1199619) The libblkid library was incorrectly evaluating internal return codes from probing functions, which caused blkid to ignore some partition types such as Sun disk label. With this update, libblkid evaluates return codes correctly and blkid provides information about all valid partitions. (BZ#1251250) Previously, the lsblk command was providing incomplete output on systems with multipath devices if the underlying device was partitioned. With this update, lsblk provides complete output containing all multipath devices. (BZ#1208081) The su command was incorrectly evaluating exit statuses of its child processes. This caused it to output an incorrect messsage, "Killed (core dumped)", when a child process was killed. With this update, su prints the correct message, "Killed", when its child process is killed. (BZ#1147526) In addition, this update adds the following enhancement: This update introduces the "-Z" option to the nsenter utility. You can use this option to automatically set the SELinux context of the new process to match the SELinux context of the target process, which enables use of nsenter with namespace-based containers. (BZ#1116100) Users of util-linux are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add this enhancement. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
